dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: I wish the car was faster.

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: That’s why we bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: So I said, “Maybe it’s not.”

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: I said “Maybe it’s not” and she said, “If you’re happy with it, that’s all that matters.”

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: -And that’s how we got this car.-

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: -Well, actually, it’s not ours.-

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: -What?

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: -I mean, we’re paying for it, but it’s not actually our car.

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: -Alright! Let me get this straight:-

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: -You mean, you don’t actually own the car?-

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: -Well now, let’s see if I get this straight.-

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: -We’re buying a car, yes, but it’s not actually ours.  See, I’ll explain it with a story.

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: -Here goes:-

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: -We can be very happy together.-

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: -It’s wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: -We’re going to name it Happiness and Freedom, right?

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: That’s right, we’ll call it Happiness and Freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: -We should buy it today.

dialogues.speaker: Ben
dialogues.text: -That sounds like the best decision we’ve made all day.

dialogues.speaker: Jane
dialogues.text: It does!
